meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Ed Hanlon Fran Frederick Claudia Gray Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6392.

td.p: Ed Hanlon, a graphic designer from Santa Monica, California
Fran Frederick, a school counselor and member of the Air National Guard from West Springfield, Massachusetts
Claudia Gray, a substitute teacher from Monrovia, California (whose 2-day cash winnings total $24,401)

tr.td: WHAT'S APENNINE
YACHTS
HOME ALONE?
(Alex: We want you to name the child left behind after his or her siblings have gone away.)
ADD A LETTER
CELEBRATIONS OF THE MONTH
(Jimmy: The triumphs of the doctors and the patience of the patients--from Chicago's International Museum of Surgical Science.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'The Apennines, the backbone of Italy, are among the younger ranges of this larger mountain system')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: The Apennines, the backbone of Italy, are among the younger ranges of this larger mountain system

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_1', 'clue_J_6_1_stuck', '(Jimmy of the Clue Crew shows us an iron lung at the Int\'l Museum of Surgical Science in Chicago.) The iron lung was used when normal breathing was impossible due to lack of muscle control; it was once a standard treatment for this disease that was tamed by vaccines in the 1950s')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew shows us an iron lung at the Int'l Museum of Surgical Science in Chicago.) The iron lung was used when normal breathing was impossible due to lack of muscle control; it was once a standard treatment for this disease that was tamed by vaccines in the 1950s

(Sarah of the Clue Crew shows us statues at the Int'l Museum of Surgical Science in Chicago.) The Hall of Immortals honors medical pioneers, like Madame Curie, ancient Egypt's Imhotep, &
of course, this man, born in Greece around 460 B.C.

Fran
Ed

AN ARMY OF OLIVERS

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: One was a silent film star and the other was a big television star.)
EdWho is Lucille Ball? Mary Pickford?
$10,400
FranWho is Mary Pickford
$10,000
ClaudiaWho is Mary Pickford?
$8,401
(1 of) Mary Pickford or Lucille Ball')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '1 of the first 2 women in Hollywood to own a studio (according to the official bio of No. 3, Oprah)')

tr.td: WOMEN IN ENTERTAINMENT
1 of the first 2 women in Hollywood to own a studio (according to the official bio of No. 3, Oprah)
Claudia
Fran
Ed
3-day champion: $45,202
3rd place: $1,000
2nd place: $2,000
Claudia
Fran
Ed

17 R,
5 W
(including 3 DDs)
